In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can use the built-in `lowercase` function in Julia to convert a string to all lower case letters. The `replace` function can be used to replace certain characters with other characters. Here is a simple implementation of your request:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Replace any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")

    return col
end
```

You can call this function like so: `clean_column("My Column")` which will return `"my_column"`.
